intro: Prenanthes khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi water dropwort, is a herbaceous plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has a taproot system and produces small, round fruits that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and a subject of ecological study.
